creditline: Gift of Edith and Norman Garmezy
inscription:
Signature and Inscription

at bottom edge, in pencil: 19.27
provenance: Charles Anzoli, Paris; Durand-Ruel et Cie., Paris & New York; Christie's, New York (sold 1996); Edith and Norman Garmezy, Edina, MN (1996)
text: Mary Cassatt is famous for her sensitive depictions of women and children and their loving relationships. Well known for her paintings and pastels, she was also a highly accomplished printmaker, executing over 200 prints. An overwhelming number are intimate portrayals of mothers and children. This one, disarming in its simplicity, is among Cassatt’s tenderest.
title: The Caress
